languages.text: {n}Капеллан чуть прищуривается.{/n} "Вы заинтригованы, я вижу. Я, признаться, тоже. С тех пор, как я услыхал о смерти моего друга, тайна его завещания не дает мне покоя. За вами — титул и имя фон Валанциус, быть может, вы вытрясете из гостей больше, чем я? Вот вам единственная зацепка, которая у меня есть: Денз всего раз упоминал при мне имя Фиделио. Это было недавно, я застал его очень пьяным — он вцепился мне в рясу и сказал... надеюсь, что помню фразу точно... "Я должен Фиделио. Если б не покаяние..."

{n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

languages.text: {n}牧师微微眯起了眼睛。{/n}“我看得出来你很好奇。我得承认，我也很好奇。自从我听说我这位朋友的死讯之后，我就始终在思考着他的遗嘱之谜。你来自冯·瓦兰修斯王朝，或许比起我来，你可以从那些客人口中打听到更多线索？我唯一知道的线索就是这个——菲迪奥这个名字，丹兹只对我提起过一次。那已经是很久以前的事情了，他当时喝得烂醉如泥，死死地抓着我的袖子……我记得他原话是这么说的……‘我欠菲迪奥的，这也是为了忏悔……’”
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

traits.locale_text: {n}牧师微微眯起了眼睛。{/n}“我看得出来你很好奇。我得承认，我也很好奇。自从我听说我这位朋友的死讯之后，我就始终在思考着他的遗嘱之谜。你来自冯·瓦兰修斯王朝，或许比起我来，你可以从那些客人口中打听到更多线索？我唯一知道的线索就是这个——菲迪奥这个名字，丹兹只对我提起过一次。那已经是很久以前的事情了，他当时喝得烂醉如泥，死死地抓着我的袖子……我记得他原话是这么说的……‘我欠菲迪奥的，这也是为了忏悔……’”

languages.text: {n}Capellán entrecierra ligeramente los ojos.{/n} «Veo que esto le intriga. A mí también, he de admitir. Desde que recibí la noticia de la muerte de mi amigo, no puedo dejar de pensar en su testamento incomprensible. Usted cuenta con el título y la influencia de los von Valancius, lo que quizá le permita obtener más información de los invitados que yo. La única pista que tengo es que Denz mencionó una sola vez el nombre Fidelio en mi presencia. Fue hace mucho, cuando estaba muy borracho. Me agarró de la túnica y dijo... espero que estas fueran las palabras exactas... "Se lo debo a Fidelio. De no ser por el arrepentimiento..."».
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

Usted cuenta con el título y la influencia de los von Valancius, lo que quizá le permita obtener más información de los invitados que yo. La única pista que tengo es que Denz mencionó una sola vez el nombre Fidelio en mi presencia. Fue hace mucho, cuando estaba muy borracho. Me agarró de la túnica y dijo... espero que estas fueran las palabras exactas... "Se lo debo a Fidelio. De no ser por el arrepentimiento...".

languages.text: {n}教戒官が少しだけ目を細めた。{/n}「興味がおありのようですね。私もです。友人の訃報を聞いて以来、彼の遺言の謎に囚われたままです。あなたはフォン・ヴァランシウスの名と肩書きをお持ちですから、私より参列者から情報を得ることができるのではないでしょうか？私が知っている唯一の手がかりを教えましょう…以前、デンツがフィデリオという名を口にしたことが一度だけあります。かなり昔のことで、彼は酔っ払っていました―私のローブを掴み…『フィデリオには借りがある。リペンタンスがなければ…』と、言ったのです」
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

traits.locale_text: {n}教戒官が少しだけ目を細めた。{/n}「興味がおありのようですね。私もです。友人の訃報を聞いて以来、彼の遺言の謎に囚われたままです。あなたはフォン・ヴァランシウスの名と肩書きをお持ちですから、私より参列者から情報を得ることができるのではないでしょうか？私が知っている唯一の手がかりを教えましょう…以前、デンツがフィデリオという名を口にしたことが一度だけあります。かなり昔のことで、彼は酔っ払っていました―私のローブを掴み…『フィデリオには借りがある。リペンタンスがなければ…』と、言ったのです」

languages.text: {n}Ordenspriesters Augen verengen sich ein wenig.{/n} "Wie ich sehe, fasziniert Euch die Sache. Ich gebe zu, mir geht es ebenso. Seit ich vom Tod meines Freundes erfahren habe, treibt mich das Geheimnis um sein Testament um. Ihr tragt Namen und Titel derer von Valancius, vielleicht könnt Ihr mehr aus den Gästen herausholen als ich? Ich kann nur mit einem einzigen Hinweis dienen: Denz hat den Namen Fidelio mir gegenüber nur einmal erwähnt. Es ist lange her, er war sehr betrunken – er klammerte sich an meine Robe und sagte ... hoffentlich sind das seine exakten Worte ... 'Ich schulde Fidelio etwas. Ohne die Repentanz ...'"
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

traits.locale_text: {n}Ordenspriesters Augen verengen sich ein wenig.{/n} "Wie ich sehe, fasziniert Euch die Sache. Ich gebe zu, mir geht es ebenso. Seit ich vom Tod meines Freunde erfahren habe, treibt mich das Geheimnis um sein Testament um. Ihr tragt Namen und Titel derer von Valancius, vielleicht könnt Ihr mehr aus den Gästen herausholen als ich? Ich kann nur mit einem einzigen Hinweis dienen: Denz hat den Namen Fidelio mir gegenüber nur einmal erwähnt. Es ist lange her, er war sehr betrunken – er klammerte sich an meine Robe und sagte ... hoffentlich sind das seine exakten Worte ... 'Ich schulde Fidelio etwas. Ohne die Repentanz ...'"

languages.text: {n}Chapelain plisse légèrement les yeux.{/n} « Je vous sens {mf|intrigué|intriguée}. Il en est de même pour moi. Depuis la mort de mon ami, je n'ai pas cessé de penser à son testament et à tout le mystère qui l'entoure. {mf|Armé|Armée} de votre nom et de votre titre, peut-être parviendrez-vous mieux que moi à tirer des informations des invités ? Voilà tout ce que je sais pour le moment : Denz a évoqué une fois le nom de Fidélio devant moi. C'était il y a bien longtemps. Il était complètement ivre, il a agrippé ma robe et m'a dit... "J'ai une dette envers Fidélio. Sans repentance..." Il me semble que ce sont ses mots exacts. »
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

traits.locale_text: {n}Chapelain plisse légèrement les yeux.{/n} « Je vous sens {mf|intrigué|intriguée}. Il en est de même pour moi. Depuis la mort de mon ami, je n'ai pas cessé de penser à son testament et à tout le mystère qui l'entoure. {mf|Armé|Armée} de votre nom et de votre titre, peut-être parviendrez-vous mieux que moi à tirer des informations des invités ? Voilà tout ce que je sais pour le moment : Denz a évoqué une fois le nom de Fidélio devant moi. C'était il y a bien longtemps. Il était complètement ivre, il a agrippé ma robe et m'a dit... "J'ai une dette envers Fidélio. Sans repentance..." Il me semble que ce sont ses mots exacts. »

languages.text: {n}Papaz'ın gözleri hafifçe kısılıyor.{/n} "İlginizi cezbetti galiba. Açıkçası benim de merakımı uyandırıyor. Arkadaşımın ölüm haberini aldığımdan beri bu vasiyetin etrafındaki sır perdesi aklımı bulandırıyor. Von Valancius adına ve ünvanına sahipsiniz, belki buradaki misafirlerin ağzından benden daha çok laf alabilirsiniz. Tek bir ipucum var. Denz, Fidelio ismini bir kez zikretti. Çok uzun zaman önceydi ve zilzurna sarhoştu. Cübbeme yapıştı ve doğru hatırlıyorsam şöyle bir söz sarf etti: 'Fidelio'ya borçluyum. Tövbe olmasaydı...'"
languages.original_text: {n}Chaplain's eyes narrow a little.{/n} "I can see that you're intrigued. I must say I am too. Ever since I heard of my friend's death, I couldn't stop thinking about the mystery of his will. You have the von Valancius name and title, perhaps you can pull more out of the guests here than I could? Here is the only clue I've got: Denz mentioned the name Fidelio to me only once. It was a long time ago, he was very drunk — he latched onto my robe and said... I hope that these are his exact words... 'I owe Fidelio. If not for the repentance...'"

traits.locale_text: {n}Papaz gözlerini kısıyor.{/n} "İlginizi çekmeyi başardım sanırım. Bu durum benim de merakımı uyandırıyor. Arkadaşımın ölüm haberini aldığımdan beri bu vasiyetin etrafındaki sır perdesi aklımı bulandırıyor. Von Valancius adına ve ünvanına sahip olan sizsiniz, belki buradaki misafirlerin ağzından benden daha çok laf alabilirsiniz. Tek bir ipucum var. Denz, Fidelio'dan bir kez bahsetti. Çok uzun zaman önceydi ve çok sarhoştu. Beni cübbemden tuttu ve doğru hatırlıyorsam tam olarak şöyle dedi: 'Fidelio'ya borçluyum. Tövbe olmasaydı...'"
